meanings.sent1: The overcommercialized toys were everywhere during the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: The mall was overcommercialized with flashy advertisements.
meanings.sent3: The overcommercialized cupcakes had edible glitter and sparklers on top.
meanings.sent4: Her overcommercialized outfit screamed 'buy me now!' to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The overcommercialized jingle played on a loop in the store, driving customers crazy.

meanings.definition: To make something excessively focused on commercial interests.
meanings.sent1: They overcommercialized the event by plastering logos on every surface.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to overcommercialize their product to increase sales.
meanings.sent3: He overcommercialized his lemonade stand by hiring a celebrity to sell the drinks.
meanings.sent4: The film studio overcommercialized the movie with endless merchandise tie-ins.
meanings.sent5: The artist refused to overcommercialize her paintings, preferring to keep them authentic.
